author: paulhauner
content: Sigma Prime/Lighthouse are going to be moving some Prymont and Prater validators to new infrastructure over this week and next. Expect some periodic outages. I don't expect us to prevent finality, but it's possible.

author: ajsutton
content: Weren't we going to shutdown Pyrmont?

author: paulhauner
content: Oh, I hadn't heard about that. I'm happy with that. One less Grafana dashboard ðŸ˜…

author: paulhauner
content: Have people started shutting down their Pyrmont nodes?

author: ajsutton
content: I don't think anyone's actually done anything to shut it down (we haven't) but I thought we were going to test altair on it then kill it in favour of prater.

author: ajsutton
content: We're definitely recommending people stop using it and ethstaker's bot won't make deposits for pyrmont anymore (only prater)

author: paulhauner
content: Oh yeah cool, we have also been recommending Prater over Pyrmont. I was aware there's been a rising tide of "lets kill pyrmont" but I wasn't aware if that tide had reached a critical point.

author: paulhauner
content: Perhaps we can discuss on this weeks eth2 call?

author: ajsutton
content: Yeah seems like a good plan.

author: ajsutton
content: It's possible my memory of conversations is just coloured by my desire to kill Pyrmont...
